title: Missing server name in error 516 notification msg.
author: daves127
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
If RDP disconnects, Notifications 'should' provide server name in error 516, like it does for error 260.
   -- RDP disconnected!  516 Remote Desktop can’t connect to the remote computer <**computer name here**> for one of...

## Current Behavior
   -- RDP disconnected!  516 Remote Desktop can’t connect to the remote computer for one of...
  -- RDP disconnected!  260 Remote Desktop can't find the com...

iterations.description: The error message for unknown RDP errors (including 516) does not include the server name, making it harder to diagnose. The current implementation of RdpErrorCodes.GetError does not receive the hostname.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The error message for unknown RDP errors (including 516) does not include the server name, making it harder to diagnose. The current implementation of RdpErrorCodes.GetError does not receive the hostname.
Approach: Modify `RdpErrorCodes.GetError` to accept `hostname` as a parameter, update `Language.RdpErrorUnknown` in `Language.resx` to include `{0}` for the hostname in its format, and pass the `connectionInfo.Hostname` from `RdpProtocol.cs` to `RdpErrorCodes.GetError` in the `RDPEvent_OnFatalError` method.
